A: 1. Capital letters are primarily used to begin sentences and for _ nouns (a) common (b) proper (c) descriptive
2. Among these words, which one requires capitalization (a) table (b) chair (c) Emily
3. The appropriate times to use capital letters in written text are at the start of sentences and for _ nouns (a) action (b) special (c) regular
4. A word that stands in place of a noun is known as a _ (a) verb (b) adjective (c) pronoun
5. Identify the pronoun from the following options (a) jump (b) house (c) she
6. The pronoun 'she' is used to refer to a _ (a) male individual (b) female individual (c) inanimate object
7. The present continuous tense is utilized to describe actions that are _ (a) completed (b) ongoing (c) planned
8. Select the sentence that exemplifies the present continuous tense (a) They sang a song (b) They are singing a song (c) They will sing a song
9. The phrase 'He is watching TV' signifies that the action is occurring _ (a) in the future (b) at this moment (c) in the past
10. In the sentence 'They are running', the pronoun is _ (a) are (b) running (c) They
11. Actions that are currently in progress are best described using the _ tense (a) simple past (b) simple future (c) present continuous
12. For the verb 'eat', what is its correct form when used in the present continuous tense (a) ate (b) eating (c) eats
13. Choose the sentence with accurate capitalization (a) john loves Apples (b) John loves apples (c) john Loves apples
14. The pronoun that can substitute 'Tom' in 'Tom is kind' is _ (a) She (b) It (c) He
15. Select the sentence written in the present continuous tense (a) She reads books (b) She is reading books (c) She will read books
16. Correct capitalization is crucial for making text easy to _ and identifying _ nouns (a) write, common (b) understand, proper (c) spell, abstract
17. Identify the pronoun in the phrase 'It is sunny' (a) is (b) sunny (c) It
18. Choose the sentence that correctly employs the present continuous tense (a) He is walk to school (b) He is walking to school (c) He walk to school
19. In written English, what elements typically require capitalization (a) action words (b) names of people, places, and the start of sentences (c) descriptive words
20. Pick the grammatically sound sentence (a) mary is singing (b) Mary is singing (c) mary Is singing
